heroImage.heading: Mode in KibeRo

kiberaStoryBuilder.textField: Deep in the Kibera slum in Kenya is a little brass workshop that is home to the production of our latest collection.
kiberaStoryBuilder.secondaryTextField: We were in Kibera with on a shoot with some locals when we met Samwel in his workshop where he's been making brass jewellery for customers in Kibera for years. Self taught and motivated to push his work, we hit it off and now he's one half of the creative force behind our Somwel x SoddO collection.

kiberaStoryBuilder.textField:
Kibera is Africa's largest slum.

When you hear the word 'slum', you probably think of poverty and desperation. And that's fair, there's plenty of that in Kibera, but there's also a mind-blowing level of industrious energy and creativity. Just like the work Samwel produces, the people here are the masters of doing a lot with a little.

And it's the people that make the place. In Kibera there's 500,000 of them packed into just a few square kilometers on the edge of downtown Nairobi. It's their hustle, creativity and determination that gives Kibera its mad energy, but something that really hit us is the strong feeling of community here. It feels more like a massive village than a city of half a million.

The place is full of small businesses - 1000's of them. Barber shops, beauty salons, cafes and carpenters. Whatever you want, thereâ€™s someone who can make it, do it, find it or fix it for you. And then there's all buses, packed with the people who leave Kibera each, spreading out into Nairobi and doing the jobs that keep the city moving.

We're not sugar-coating it though - sickness, addiction, violence , people surviving off next to nothing - life's hard in Kibera. And in amongst all that, there's load of kids having to deals with adult level problems.
kiberaStoryBuilder.secondaryTextField: The kids made a big impact on us and that's why we're dedicating 50% of the profits from the Saddo x Samwel collection to Amani Kibera, an organisation run by our friend Ben Oko who's getting kids in Kibera into sport and entrepreneurship.

kiberaStoryBuilder.titleField: Made in Kibera: Samwel x Saddo
kiberaStoryBuilder.introduction: So Samwel was on board, but we needed another collaborator and we thought of our friend Saddo. He's a Romanian contemporary artist working with street art and pop culture influences whose work felt perfect to match the energy and action of Kibera... he was into it!
kiberaStoryBuilder.description: Footballâ€™s huge in Kibera. The jerseyâ€™s are everywhere, kids are kicking balls in the street and when thereâ€™s a match, the sports bars are packed. So we gave Saddo the theme of â€˜footballâ€™, he sketched some designs, handed them over and Samwel got to work. That was the beginnings of the Somwel x SoddO collection!
kiberaStoryBuilder.leftImageCaption: Samwel doing his thing in his Kibera workshop

kiberaStoryBuilder.textField:
